businessProfile.name: Slice Brothers Pizza
businessProfile.address: 519 E Hennepin Ave, Minneapolis, MN 55414, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 519 E Hennepin Ave, Minneapolis, MN 55414, USA

reviews.text: It was ok, if cruising by and need a really quick slice I'd still recommend. But nothing special, kind of around a school cafeteria slice and a papa Murphy's. Tasted good enough, but no crisp, no fluff crust. Should be like a 2-3 buck slice instead of 5+...

Great place to quick stop in and get a slice of tasty pizza. Crust was amazing!! Slices are pre-made; you order and get your pizza slice handed out the window within a couple minutes. There's tables to stand and eat at or a couple seats/concrete barriers to sit at and eat.

Deluxe was delicious, pepperoni was very greasy, dill pickle ranch was flavorful and fun.

No indoor seating. Price is

I‚Äôm originally from New Jersey - where you can find a pizza shop every few blocks - and I‚Äôve been craving New Jersey/New York-style pizza by the slice since relocating to Minneapolis. This pizza comes pretty darn close to East Coast pizza. I loved everything about it- the bountiful oregano, sweet and spicy sauce, and the spongy crust. Such a treat and worth every penny. Plus, it was big enough to fold, which is my go-to pizza eating method. Also, the staff was really friendly and helpful. I will definitely be coming back soon! Bravo!

Best Pizza in town ( Midtown Global )  .  Unique pizza selection and a great staff. Get the 16in pizza you won‚Äôt be disappointed. Stop in just for lunch and get the 2 slice combo for a great price . Can‚Äôt say enough about these guys. Repeat Customer

Slice is spectacular. Awesome folks, great service, and delicious pizza.

The slices are huge. Each one is hand-tossed with a great dough that‚Äôs wonderfully chewy and holds up everything. The sauce is super fresh, with a nice spice (flavor, not heat). It‚Äôs topped with tasty cheese and then whatever toppings you choose. I went with The Meats, which is sausage, pepperoni, bacon, sliced chicken served on hand-tossed dough with their original sauce. It‚Äôs absolutely killer.

The staff are really great. I arrived as one was dealing with a DoorDash issue. Though it wasn‚Äôt their fault, I could hear he was going above and beyond to help the customer get things made right. Providing the support number and telling them he‚Äôd be following up too. He didn‚Äôt have to but he did everything he could to make things right. He took the time to acknowledge me while helping the person on the phone and apologized (no need to) for not being with me sooner. Served my pie up with a smile and a genuine thank you for ordering.

Slice is really special. Not only is it wonderful pizza (well, it is) but also great folks who care about people and product.

Check out Slice in NE Minneapolis. Amazing pizza and people.

recentReviews.text: Stopped by for lunch today and the place looks not only closed, but like‚Ä¶derelict. Shuttered and the glass door was smashed up. As was my whole lunch break. At least change the business hours or something.
The pizza is outstanding, only issue is they dont have that many options ready at lunch time.
Good taste, just thinner than anticipated. Fast service.

Used to be more consistent, hours are weird? They seem to take lunch, right when everyone else is also taking lunch, meaning they can‚Äôt get pizza here because the singular employee is gone, eating a sandwich somewhere else???????? Uhhhhh? What?
Best pizza, and especially the best crust in the metro hands down
I thought it was solid pizza for a fine price

food is great, service is ass. the employees seem to never know what's actually on their menu, and if a certain slice isn't ready to be cut the employees will say they can't sell you it. Only if you insist, do they then sell you the slice but they make you wait. And it seems the wait times are arbitrary. I've had an employee tell me it's a 7 minute wait to get a supreme slice, and I've had the other employee tell me it's a 25 minute wait. In both cases, I was the only customer whether IRL or online. I could tell I was the only customer, because as I was walking up to the shop in both instances the employee wasn't actively making pizzas, he was on his phone sitting down. Also they have a phone number, and the answering machine gives you the option to speak with an employee directly. But idk why they give you that option, considering the employees will purposefully ignore the calls. I've tried calling ahead over a dozen different times to check if they can sell me a slice without waiting and over a dozen times I've never had my call answered. I have even called and selected option 4 to speak with an employee while in front of the store waiting on my food, and witnessed the employee proceed to ignore and not pick up the ringing phone...
so yeah it seems like both employees will do anything in their power to do as little work as possible. which is a shame because the pizza is the best pizza in NE mpls. if the owner(s) of slice bros cared more about their employees' work ethic this restaurant could become the best pizza place in the entire twin cities.

It was ok, if cruising by and need a really quick slice I'd still recommend. But nothing special, kind of around a school cafeteria slice and a papa Murphy's. Tasted good enough, but no crisp, no fluff crust. Should be like a 2-3 buck slice instead of 5+...

detailedReviews.author: Kevin Brondani
detailedReviews.text: Stopped by for lunch today and the place looks not only closed, but like‚Ä¶derelict. Shuttered and the glass door was smashed up. As was my whole lunch break. At least change the business hours or something.

detailedReviews.author: mitch huus
detailedReviews.text: The pizza is outstanding, only issue is they dont have that many options ready at lunch time.

detailedReviews.author: T Porter
detailedReviews.text: Good taste, just thinner than anticipated. Fast service.

detailedReviews.author: loungin_ tony
detailedReviews.text: Freshly heated! Good stuff!

detailedReviews.author: Joe Anderson
detailedReviews.text: Used to be more consistent, hours are weird? They seem to take lunch, right when everyone else is also taking lunch, meaning they can‚Äôt get pizza here because the singular employee is gone, eating a sandwich somewhere else???????? Uhhhhh? What?

detailedReviews.author: Erik Heathcote
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza, and especially the best crust in the metro hands down

detailedReviews.author: Marty Davsi
detailedReviews.text: I thought it was solid pizza for a fine price

detailedReviews.author: I F
detailedReviews.text:
food is great, service is ass. the employees seem to never know what's actually on their menu, and if a certain slice isn't ready to be cut the employees will say they can't sell you it. Only if you insist, do they then sell you the slice but they make you wait. And it seems the wait times are arbitrary. I've had an employee tell me it's a 7 minute wait to get a supreme slice, and I've had the other employee tell me it's a 25 minute wait. In both cases, I was the only customer whether IRL or online. I could tell I was the only customer, because as I was walking up to the shop in both instances the employee wasn't actively making pizzas, he was on his phone sitting down. Also they have a phone number, and the answering machine gives you the option to speak with an employee directly. But idk why they give you that option, considering the employees will purposefully ignore the calls. I've tried calling ahead over a dozen different times to check if they can sell me a slice without waiting and over a dozen times I've never had my call answered. I have even called and selected option 4 to speak with an employee while in front of the store waiting on my food, and witnessed the employee proceed to ignore and not pick up the ringing phone...
so yeah it seems like both employees will do anything in their power to do as little work as possible. which is a shame because the pizza is the best pizza in NE mpls. if the owner(s) of slice bros cared more about their employees' work ethic this restaurant could become the best pizza place in the entire twin cities.

detailedReviews.author: g gerl
detailedReviews.text: It was ok, if cruising by and need a really quick slice I'd still recommend. But nothing special, kind of around a school cafeteria slice and a papa Murphy's. Tasted good enough, but no crisp, no fluff crust. Should be like a 2-3 buck slice instead of 5+...

detailedReviews.author: Emily C
detailedReviews.text: 3 stars bc i haven‚Äôt had it yet, but showed up and couldn‚Äôt get inside and seemed like no one was there? i was there during opening hours. just wondering if the hours changed or if the location is shut down?? i‚Äôd love to try this place.

detailedReviews.author: John Goldsworthy
detailedReviews.text: Extremely difficult to find parking. Way overpriced and the guy taking the order was rude. Learn how to make basic conversation.

detailedReviews.author: Leonel Chavez
detailedReviews.text: Incredibly average pizza. There‚Äôs nothing wrong with pizza that‚Äôs average, but for the price, it makes it pretty bad.

detailedReviews.author: Ducky Brooks
detailedReviews.text: Rude customer service. I was told one price and when I was rang up charged to a different price. So I didn't go any further and walked away. They still charged my debit card and refused to refund something I never got. don't go

detailedReviews.author: Jordan I
detailedReviews.text: Best Pizza in town ( Midtown Global )  .  Unique pizza selection and a great staff. Get the 16in pizza you won‚Äôt be disappointed. Stop in just for lunch and get the 2 slice combo for a great price . Can‚Äôt say enough about these guys. Repeat Customer

detailedReviews.author: Dustin Hilliard
detailedReviews.text: It's ok. The pizza is too sweet. The crust is bland, greasy, and otherwise just there. If you are close and need something fast, it'll get you by. Not worth going out of your way for. Absolutely not worth the price, not even close. This is a $1-2 slice for $5.

detailedReviews.author: Monique Fierros
detailedReviews.text: Fast service and amazing pizza!!

detailedReviews.author: Terrell Devon
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in city Great customer service

detailedReviews.author: Mallory S
detailedReviews.text: Fresh pizza with a crust on the thinner side, basic and delicious, quick service, reasonable prices.

detailedReviews.author: Amy Brodt
detailedReviews.text: I have been to midtown and n.e. Locations and always great New York style slices fast service and  great value love love love

detailedReviews.author: F0rkhub
detailedReviews.text: Great people and great service

detailedReviews.author: Cormac Cronin
detailedReviews.text: I did not like the pizza . It was not great for the price I come from Italy over to America and pay 5.94 for a slice of pizza in napoli my hometown I can get a hole pizza for 5 euro so lower your darn price ok .

detailedReviews.author: Hailey Bradley
detailedReviews.text: Amazing place!

detailedReviews.author: Alex Potter
detailedReviews.text: Way to be a pillar of the community!

detailedReviews.author: val kahn
detailedReviews.text: Slice pizza is the place to go! Absolutely outstanding pizza, best in town. The staff are impeccable and nothing less of amazing. I couldn‚Äôt recommend this place enough

detailedReviews.author: Trent Witz
detailedReviews.text: One of best pizzas!

detailedReviews.author: Natalie Kegel
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza but I wish they were open for late night. With so many bars and nightclubs nearby, a slice of pizza at 1 am on the way home would be incredible.

detailedReviews.author: Thomas Spargo
detailedReviews.text:
The pizza is ok ‚Äî good drunk pizza. I'd give another star if this place had late night hours for when this pizza would be most viable.

Edit: This pizza place is never on my radar because it's never open when needed. Rural pizza places have better hours than this prime place in the middle of two of NE busiest streets. This is a good-faith plea to the owners to reconsider their hours of operations because you're a limited value for a place that serves pizza from a window only during daylight most days.

detailedReviews.author: C K
detailedReviews.text: A wonderful place to get a pizza! Cute little walk up window & quick crafting of such a yummy pizza. Generous & patient employees really go the extra mile üòä

detailedReviews.author: Terry Horstman
detailedReviews.text: I‚Äôve been by a few times now and every single time it‚Äôs been fantastic. Excellent slices right out of the oven and the service has been top notch. The pizza scene in Minneapolis is strong, but we need more pizza by the slice places. So lucky to have this one in the neighborhood!

detailedReviews.author: Michael Langlie
detailedReviews.text: Outstanding,  If you've been searching for a great slice and you miss the pizza from NY. This will get you closer than anything I've had in minneapolis.  8.4.

detailedReviews.author: Jim Gerhardinger
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in the city

detailedReviews.author: A V
detailedReviews.text: It was okay but needs more pickles. Not the freshest either.

detailedReviews.author: Onyedimma Nwachuku
detailedReviews.text: Love stopping by here at the original Slice Brothers location. Everything is nice and quick and the flavors are on point. Got myself a classic cheese slice and a meats slice. They have a few countertops to eat outside but this is mostly a takeout pizza spot. Huge NY style slices at a great price!

detailedReviews.author: C. D. Hughes
detailedReviews.text: Slice is my favorite pizza, by the slice, restaurant.  The Hennepin is a drive up location, which makes it so convenient.  I had a few slices of their pickle pizza and a slice of meat.  The slices were fresh, hot and entirely delicious!  The rewards program is also a fantastic benefit.

detailedReviews.author: Amber Panda
detailedReviews.text: Their slices are extremely mediocre (crust that tastes like it‚Äôs just flour and water, next to no sauce, minimal cheese, floppy, tastes old), and the first time I was there, before their touch screen was added, they overcharged me $4. It‚Äôd be fine if it was like $2 a slice, especially if you‚Äôre drunk and can barely taste anything, but as is I‚Äôm just gonna avoid going here in the future.

detailedReviews.author: Meeka M
detailedReviews.text: Me and my partner ate here on Friday and I was the only thing we had eaten that was similar. He went to his parents for dinner and I went out later for dinner . Our stomach cramps started at the same time, awful abdominal pain, and put us out of commission for the rest of the night in the bathroom.

detailedReviews.author: Sarah Carsello
detailedReviews.text:
Great place to quick stop in and get a slice of tasty pizza. Crust was amazing!! Slices are pre-made; you order and get your pizza slice handed out the window within a couple minutes. There's tables to stand and eat at or a couple seats/concrete barriers to sit at and eat.

Deluxe was delicious, pepperoni was very greasy, dill pickle ranch was flavorful and fun.

No indoor seating. Price is <$5.00 a slice.

detailedReviews.author: Trypp Adams
detailedReviews.text: Thin crust, triangle cut pizza. This walk up window offers fair weather seating outside but otherwise plan on to-go service. The crust is thin and crisp like a cracker. I ordered a slice of pepperoni and pickle and dill and was told 6-7 minutes wait. The pickle and dill had great flavors, the pepperoni was very forgettable. There is parking for 1, maybe 2 vehicles if you approach from Hennepin Avenue. If you live within a few blocks, maybe? Wouldn't go out of my way for it though.

detailedReviews.author: Caitlin M
detailedReviews.text: For a quick dinner, you can‚Äôt beat this. Love this spot, the pizza is good and the price is right!

detailedReviews.author: thomas bellflower
detailedReviews.text: It's a slice done well. Easy and quick.

detailedReviews.author: D B
detailedReviews.text: I love grabbing a slice and posting up, to watch life go by. The menu is easy to choose from, the slice size is ample, and the pizza a great. I love this little spot. Go support em‚Äô

detailedReviews.author: anthony larkin
detailedReviews.text: Decent place to get a slice over your lunch break

detailedReviews.author: anthony fortier
detailedReviews.text: Crust‚Ä¶excellent, sauce was good, good toppings. Only one issue, a bit oily, I had to drain about a half quart of oil before I ate it. Overall a good solid slice, just wish it was not so oily. Employees were excellent!

detailedReviews.author: Stephen Armstrong
detailedReviews.text: The toppings are really skimpy I would not recommend this

detailedReviews.author: Zachary Abelson
detailedReviews.text: Great place to transfer buses and grab a slice if you are pressed for time ask for what's ready, all the ones I've tried so far are great but the pickle is best. Having time to get pizza is the one upside of our awful bus frequencies

detailedReviews.author: Andria Daniel
detailedReviews.text: The pizza was so good! I got a slice of supreme pizza.

detailedReviews.author: leidy rosario
detailedReviews.text: For 2 slices it was 10+ $, The pepperoni was more like dat old reheated pizza, was very disappointed. The crust was hard and pizza was not hot compresses to the dill pickle which was fresh and hotter and nice/floppy foldable. For this Cost I‚Äôd rather go eat at Element pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Kathy Malec
detailedReviews.text: Ordered a slice of there pickled pizza üçï I'd been wanting to get a slice. It's very good.

detailedReviews.author: Daisy Hull
detailedReviews.text: The pizza was sooooooo good I will be back

detailedReviews.author: Patrick Plank
detailedReviews.text: The crust alone is awesome. Add on the fresh variety of toppings. Yummy üòã

detailedReviews.author: STUBBLE BUBBLE
detailedReviews.text: Good quick stop slice spot

detailedReviews.author: Jon Smith
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza stop.

detailedReviews.author: Ebiere Okah
detailedReviews.text: Great location, and pizza came out promptly. However, the crust was off. This isn't NYC pizza crust, which is normally firmer and creates these amazing air pockets. This pizza tasted like Kirkland pizza, which is a great pizza for the price. Unfortunately they didn't charge me the Costco slice.

detailedReviews.author: david david
detailedReviews.text:
Best tasting pizza ever!!! Also, I recently had a problem with my order. The manager was so awesome to work with, and handled. My situation perfectly made me feel like my issue was important to them. They went above and beyond.

David says thanks !

detailedReviews.author: jeanne ardinger
detailedReviews.text: Ordered a pepperoni slice to try first. Crust was thin and crunched with each bite as a ny style pizza should. It was scalding hot and I had to wait several minutes before eating it. Cheese was good and I'm pretty sure whole milk mozzarella, opposed to skim. Sauce was light ,again the pizza places I frequently went in my were the same. Pepperoni was thin and I'd prefer a thick cut to hold up better in cooking , it was tasty though. The grease level was medium to high which is like most ny pizzas. I decided to go for a build your own with chicken and bacon to bring home. Sorry no pictures of that as it was gobbled up fast. Build your own signage says 18" but as other reviews have said it is now 16" and the ordering tablet says this. If you can spend more ( think almost double) go to Broders about 20 minutes away. I do think Slice is a good knock off ny slice and the price is fair for the ample portion. Parking is room for 1 car if it is free. There is street parking across from the place but limited as well . If someone in your group goes to brasa you can run over from parking there.

detailedReviews.author: Heidi V
detailedReviews.text:
We had a slice of the pickle pizza & a large cheese pizza. Both were delicious!
The pickle pizza was very crispy, good flavor, could have used more of the ranch sauce though.
The cheese pizza was less crispy, very saucy and great flavor overall!

detailedReviews.author: Andrew McPartland
detailedReviews.text: Best New York style slice in town.

detailedReviews.author: Erik Rosenberger
detailedReviews.text: This location and the midtown location are the worst. They deliver pizza that is marginally better than dominos and charge 4x the price. Incredibly disappointed that this is a black owned business and they are proud of the facts they are subpar. No accountability, which is not surprising. They care about money and money only, when it‚Äôs convenient.

detailedReviews.author: Kyle Eaton
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza and ownership. NY slices are always reliable.

detailedReviews.author: Nihal Bhakta
detailedReviews.text: Pretty good pizza! Crust needs to be little more crisp since it‚Äôs thin crust otherwise it‚Äôs too floppy. Other than that decent & fairly priced.

detailedReviews.author: Sam R
detailedReviews.text:
Ummmm‚Ä¶ first thing I could say is I see why the Ninja Turtles only ate ‚ÄúNew York‚Äù Style Pizza. This pizza was that good!!! I‚Äôve had giordanos and other artisan pizzas through Twin Cities but this one is good from the crust to the pepperoni!!!!! I‚Äôm very satisfied and it‚Äôs in my number one pizza spot!!! I‚Äôll always choose you over the rest!

So good, soft crust, great sauce to cheese ratio and the flavor is 100%. I just had the pepperoni so excited to try the rest.

100/10
*chefs kiss*

detailedReviews.author: Snake Boy
detailedReviews.text: You can't get a better lunch for $5 in this area, the white sauce on the buffalo chicken pineapple is perfect!

detailedReviews.author: Noelle Vertina
detailedReviews.text: my picky toddler LOVES this pizza so its our new go-to spot! We love the dill pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Christopher Siebenaler
detailedReviews.text: I ordered pickup but when I showed up they were closed. I called today to get a refund and the line is busy. Are they shut down for good?

detailedReviews.author: lavell coleman
detailedReviews.text: Me and my wife stop by here for the first time I must say Great üçï and great price for a slice will be back soon

detailedReviews.author: Clark Andreasen
detailedReviews.text:
The pizza is great but it got smaller recently (used to be giant 18", now no reference to size on the menu, it's closer to 15-16" now, way less pizza) and the price stayed the same, their in person menu even says 18" still, plus they can't seem to keep consistent hours. If not for those two things it would be 5 stars, you can't get pizza like that most places in MN.

Hope they do more with the outdoor seating area come spring!

detailedReviews.author: S
detailedReviews.text:
I love Slice. It's my favorite pizza in town, but they just changed the pizza from 18 inch to 16 inch. No mention on the website and the price is the same.

This is 30% less pizza for the same price. This is disappointing.

detailedReviews.author: Ima Giant
detailedReviews.text: Love this place (Midtown Global)!  You have to try it!!!

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.1/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers consistently praise the pizza for being the best in town, especially highlighting the outstanding crust. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
The restaurant is noted for its fast service, making it a convenient option for lunch. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The unique pizza selection and great value, such as the 2 slice combo, are highly appreciated by repeat customers. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
improvementOpportunities: Inconsistent and unclear business hours leading to customer frustration - review management can address this concern
Negative reviews about customer service and employee behavior - review management can address this concern
Limited operating hours not aligning with customer demand, especially for late-night service - social media marketing can improve this area

positive.author: mitch huus
positive.text: The pizza is outstanding, only issue is they dont have that many options ready at lunch time.

positive.author: T Porter
positive.text: Good taste, just thinner than anticipated. Fast service.

neutral.author: Joe Anderson
neutral.text: Used to be more consistent, hours are weird? They seem to take lunch, right when everyone else is also taking lunch, meaning they can‚Äôt get pizza here because the singular employee is gone, eating a sandwich somewhere else???????? Uhhhhh? What?

neutral.author: g gerl
neutral.text: It was ok, if cruising by and need a really quick slice I'd still recommend. But nothing special, kind of around a school cafeteria slice and a papa Murphy's. Tasted good enough, but no crisp, no fluff crust. Should be like a 2-3 buck slice instead of 5+...

neutral.author: Emily C
neutral.text: 3 stars bc i haven‚Äôt had it yet, but showed up and couldn‚Äôt get inside and seemed like no one was there? i was there during opening hours. just wondering if the hours changed or if the location is shut down?? i‚Äôd love to try this place.

negative.author: Kevin Brondani
negative.text: Stopped by for lunch today and the place looks not only closed, but like‚Ä¶derelict. Shuttered and the glass door was smashed up. As was my whole lunch break. At least change the business hours or something.

negative.author: I F
negative.text:
food is great, service is ass. the employees seem to never know what's actually on their menu, and if a certain slice isn't ready to be cut the employees will say they can't sell you it. Only if you insist, do they then sell you the slice but they make you wait. And it seems the wait times are arbitrary. I've had an employee tell me it's a 7 minute wait to get a supreme slice, and I've had the other employee tell me it's a 25 minute wait. In both cases, I was the only customer whether IRL or online. I could tell I was the only customer, because as I was walking up to the shop in both instances the employee wasn't actively making pizzas, he was on his phone sitting down. Also they have a phone number, and the answering machine gives you the option to speak with an employee directly. But idk why they give you that option, considering the employees will purposefully ignore the calls. I've tried calling ahead over a dozen different times to check if they can sell me a slice without waiting and over a dozen times I've never had my call answered. I have even called and selected option 4 to speak with an employee while in front of the store waiting on my food, and witnessed the employee proceed to ignore and not pick up the ringing phone...
so yeah it seems like both employees will do anything in their power to do as little work as possible. which is a shame because the pizza is the best pizza in NE mpls. if the owner(s) of slice bros cared more about their employees' work ethic this restaurant could become the best pizza place in the entire twin cities.

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
